Message.Title: Europe’s Banks Sell U.S. Subprime Debt for Salvation
Message.Msg: With rate low for too long......you will see another subrime Bubble... 53% gain on subrime by Euro banks ??? Europe’s Banks Sell U.S. Subprime Debt for Salvation While European banks and governments need to sell assets to raise capital or repay taxpayer-funded rescues, investors are seeking riskier, potentially higher-paying securities as central banks globally push down yields on safer debt. With U.S. home prices rising at the fastest pace in seven years, that has turbocharged demand for non-agency bonds, with subprime-backed debt returning 12.7 percent this year after rallying more than 41 percent in 2012, according to Barclays Plc data.

Topic.Title: Europe’s Banks Sell U.S. Subprime Debt for Salvation

Message.Msg: Are you saying it's a bad thing that the banks are able to finally unload this debt? At this point in the cycle I think it shows that markets are healthy. It's not the subprime debt itself that is bad, it is excess that mortgage companies went to in order to originate subprime loans that was bad. Higher risk loan securities have always been out there. As long as we don't return to the same abuses as in the past, this is healthy.

Message.Title: U.S. Banking System Upgraded to Stable by Moody’s as Risks Fall
Message.Msg: Moody’s Investors Service upgraded its view of the U.S. banking system to “stable” from “negative” for the first time since 2008, citing an improved operating environment and less risk from a weak economy. Lenders have built capital and reduced costs from bad credit, Moody’s said in a statement today. Pedestrians walk past the Moody's Investors Service Inc. logo displayed outside of the company's headquarters in New York. “Sustained GDP growth and improving employment conditions will help banks protect their now-stronger balance sheets,” Sean Jones, co-author of the report, said in the statement.

Message.Title: Bank of America to sell rural NY and PA branches
Message.Msg: From May 24, 2013 SEC Live digest: Bank of America (BAC) is seeking buyers for approximately 40 of its New York and Pennsylvania branches as the company explores ways to cut costs and increase profit in more populous areas. The 40 branches hold approximately $1B in deposits and could likely sell for between $20M and $30M. Since Brian Moynihan took over Bank of America as CEO in 2010 he has focused on optimizing the bank’s branch count from 6,000 to around 5,000. According to its latest report, BAC has 5,389 branches currently. Moynihan’s move to reduce brick and mortar branch locations is directly tied to the trend of more customers turning to mobile banking services. The trend is currently running at a rate of 10,000 customers daily. Potential buyers for the rural banking branches could be FNB Corporation, Community Bank System, National Penn Bancshares, or smaller banks with less than $25B in assets.

Message.Title: Taxes
Message.Msg: HR Block will go up by 25%, and here’s why. RTRP: (registered tax return preparer). There’s legislation in the works that will require preparers to be certified by the feds, pass a test, maintain a license, etc. That’s going to put millions of preparers out of work. Therefore, HRB will have a 10 fold increase in returns. It’s simply supply and demand. Every preparer, told every client, that an RTRP would be required next year. That news will spread and many more people will have their returns completed by HRB.

Topic.Title: * DRAM $4.45 UP ANOTHER 10%....1) HUGE AMD DEAL, 2) MEMORY PRICES UP 70% IN 2013...WAS $35 IN 2010...TODAY IT'S STRONGER & MORE DIVERSIFIED

Message.Msg: Huge recent DRAM news.....NEW MEMORY MANUFACTURING DEAL WITH AMD... 2/2013 11:21AM Dataram (NASDAQ: DRAM) announces memory manufacturing partnership with Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) (DRAM) 4.40 +1.37 : Co announced a significant partnership with Advanced Micro Devices (AMD). This partnership includes Dataram Corporation as an AMD memory-manufacturing partner to produce AMD's new Gamer Series memory. Gamer Series memory is compatible with AMD and Intel platforms, supporting both AMP and XMP memory profiles. The memory is being sold and marketed under the AMD Radeon Memory brand, targeting gaming enthusiasts interested in exceptional memory performance and reliability. "AMD Radeon RG2133 Gamer Series Memory is armed with features designed to outperform the competition on any task," said Roman Kyrychynskyi, product director, Graphics Business Unit, AMD. "Designed with multi-platform compatibility in mind, the AMD Radeon RG2133 brings cutting-edge technology, as well as uncompromising quality and compatibility for PC gamers. "AMD and Dataram have worked together to significantly enhance the dynamic background load-and-save feature in order to create a seamless, non-volatile RAMDisk experience," said Jason Caulkins, CTO, Dataram. "This underscores AMD and Dataram's continued dedication to delivering the highest-performing memory products for PC enthusiasts. In addition to the launch of AMD Radeon Gamer Series memory, Dataram is partnered with AMD to produce AMD Radeon Value, Entertainment and Performance series memory products. Dataram is actively expanding the current offerings within each of the AMD Radeon Memory product lines. It's proprietary RAMDisk product is currently utilized by individuals and commercial users in a number of attractive market segments. Dataram plans to develop even higher performance RAMDisk products to further expand into these markets.

Message.Title: Soaring Home Prices Fuel Bank of America Stock
Message.Msg: Bank stocks are climbing today after investors learned that home prices surged in March to a multi-year high. Roughly halfway through the trading session, shares of Bank of America (NYSE: BAC ) are up by 1.3%, slightly lagging the broader KBW Bank Index (DJINDICES: ^BKX ) which is higher by 1.7%. Bank of America stock has struggled over the last few years after the floor fell out from under the housing market and the nation's second largest lender, along with many of its peers, was forced to realize billions of dollars' worth of losses related to subprime lending. To be fair, most of the losses came about as a result of Bank of America's now-lamentable decision to acquire Countrywide Financial in 2008, but at the end of the day, losses are losses. The good news is that the housing market appears to have bottomed out at the beginning of last year and has since mounted an impressive reascent. Investors got a taste of this last Wednesday when the National Association of Relators reported that existing-home sales hit the highest rate last month since November 2009. This was followed up on Friday by the Commerce Department's announcement (link opens PDF) that new home sales in April had followed suit, increasing by 29% on a year-over-year basis.

Topic.Title: THIS IS WHAT I AM TALKING - BAC

Message.Msg: "tooth": Fully agree it has become a real pain to see this B/S every day. Stock should be at least book by now. Book hovering around 20.63 at last DD. Others as Posted are at book or better. One serious flaw with BAC is BAC was ALLOWED to be "controlled" as soon as Dodd-Frank was imposed by this administration. Yes, PPS was way down first, but Bill has had a lot to do with it. O.K. With a low PPS the hedge funds moved in, and were permitted to do so by SEC apathy. The hedge funds have literally controlled the Stock since then. Pennies on strength, short selling, keeping the PPS low so as to control more shares. After judges ruling we will see a spike, but the hedgies will take it off the top again! Beginning to think maybe money best used elsewhere. This thought after 23 years of ownership. SEC may not be strong enough to stop this without congressional passage of a new UPTICK RULE. A tax added to each short sale as well. GL.

Topic.Title: George Wallace would have made a GOOD president !

Message.Msg: yes, sure there was a time when Wallace was available and desirable to almost everyone as with Lord Palmerston or Pitt the Elder. The world wants to know more about you, in a setting where you can be more expressive and show us how you would lead a small entity first and then maybe a world leading nation. What have you done for vietnam lately? You may put too much emphasis on how you interact with money but when you are not deciding about program sponsorships, how do you treat people? Message.Title: Chart Of The Day: Crushed US Consumer + All Time High New Home Prices = Record Housing Bubble
Message.Msg: Chart Of The Day: Crushed US Consumer + All Time High New Home Prices = Record Housing Bubble Housing BubbleHousing MarketPurchasing Power We must have discovered a new bug in excel, because when we took median new home prices (which a week ago hit an all time high) which we then divided by the average American's purchasing power expressed through real disposable income per capita, we got this chart... ... which is impossible, as it would imply that not only are homes the most unaffordable they have ever been, but that the cheap credit propping up the housing market is bigger than it has ever been in history.
